Title:
Molecular phylogeny and taxonomic revision of Trechisporales
(Agaricomycetes, Basidiomycota): four new species, three new
combinations and a new family, Sistotremastraceae fam. nov.
Keywords:
Hydnodontaceae, Phylogenetic analysis, Trechispora,
woodrotting fungi
Abstract:
A new family of Trechisporales, Sistotremastraceae fam.
nov. is proposed based on the combination of molecular and morphological
data, and it is typified by Sistotremastrum. The phylogenetic analyses
inferred from the combined dataset of ITS+LSU, show that
Sistotremastraceae forms a monophyletic lineage with high support within
Trechisporales (100% BS, 100% BP, 1.00 BPP, Fig. 12). The new family is
characterized by resupinate thin basidioma, smooth, verruculose or
odontioid-semiporoid hymenophore, a monomitic hyphal structure, and
generative hyphae bearing clamp connections, the presence of cystidia
and hyphidia in some species, thin-walled, smooth, inamyloid and
acyanophilous basidiospores. In addition, four new species are described
and illustrated in this paper, i.e., Trechispora dentata, T. dimitiella,
T. fragilis and T. levispora. Besides, three new combinations, i.e.,
Brevicellicium daweishanensis, B. xantha and Sertulicium limonadense,
are also proposed based on examination of type materials or phylogenetic
analyses of type sequences. Besides, two Trechispora spp. and one
Sistotremastrum sp. are proposed.
